intro: Pomatotheca humillima, commonly known as the dwarf pomatotheca, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its growth habit is low-growing, often forming dense mats on the ground. Pomatotheca humillima is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with specialized structures that help it retain water and withstand high temperatures.
